sub-events.comment: Display the text immediatly
On a choice line, move the cursor down and the "SpriteFont.Y+n" will have to be edited alongside if you want to change where the choice cursor spawns on screen.

Skip all the dialogue, only use if nothing happens during the dialogue Though, you can use the >> type='wait' << property for a dialogue segment in the xml to prevent skipping. Like: "<TextLine id='15' id_next='16' type='wait' begin_function='move_deku'>" as example.
On a choice line, move the cursor up and the "SpriteFont.Y+n" will have to be edited alongside if you want to change where the choice cursor spawns on screen.
Go to the next text line
Move the dialogue box on top of layer
Request the xml file and load the variables. The set "dialogue_loaded" key is not really needed to function properly though if you want to be safe to ensure the text is loaded.

Unless you want text showing as soon as your project loads, use >> Call "dialogue" ("dialogue_name") << to call a dialogue segment upon interacting with a sign or NPC along with any other conditions needed (i.e, a NPC that you cannot interact with until a specific point in your game)
When the font is created, set up it's width characteristics.
It is recommended that the space character not be included in the spritefont sheet, (it can also skew the results), so set it's width manually.
Loop through the array and set the widths.
The one below here is for the Choice's spritefont (as there's two, one for text and one for choice dialogue)
Loop through the array and set the widths.
Typewriter effect. Increase both of the 2s below if you want to speed up the typewriter effect.
Initiate a dialogue, use the dialogue id as a parameter
Remove the dialogue box
Go to the next dialogue line or end the dialogue
Improved line wrapping (SpriteFont has an instance variable that determines the max character limit per line)
Counts the lines that the current paragraph has as the name implies.
Function to process variables from the dict into the text
It replaces the variables name by their value in the dictionnary
Function to play/stop music, you can customize this too (such as having a variable check as a fork under the function call to play different music based on situation)
Process a line of dialogue
